intro: Cryptantha hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cryptantha hispidissima is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
